r10401 | colin | 2010-12-13 15:34:45 -0500 (Mon, 13 Dec 2010) | 7 lines

FLUID-3711: Antranig's patch to the Reorderer to enable descriptive labels when focusing and moving Reorderer elements. The past couple of commits against FLUID-3711 provide the following new features for the Reorderer:

i) Every cell comes attached with an aria-label which provides information on the coordinate position of the cell, as well as deriving part of the label from a nominated selector attached to the node
ii) On a move, the aria-label for the just-moved element is temporarily updated to report the fact that it moved and the coordinates it moved from
ii) In addition to ii), the same text attached to the "temporary label" is also issued into a live-region with priority "polite" which should then dynamically announce the fact of the move after the keypress


------------------------------------------------------------------------

r10364 | antranig@caret.cam.ac.uk | 2010-12-09 14:02:54 -0500 (Thu, 09 Dec 2010) | 1 line

FLUID-3730, FLUID-3710, FLUID-3711: New "little component" to allow aria-labelling of elements. This is intended to allow dynamic updates of the labels, but currently none of the ATs tested (JAWS, NVDA) respond to dynamic changes in the labels, even within a live-region. However, this functionality has been integrated into the reorderer under FLUID-3771 which narrates the row and column geometry of the reorderer in these labels. A core framework upgrade was required to support "priorities" attached to listeners attached to events and also to support these during options merging. FluidIoC, FluidView and DataBinding are now all required dependencies of the Reorderer and all tests and demos are updated to reflect this.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

FLUID-3866: Omitted mergePolicy from earlier commit. This does provide the affordance of dynamically adjustable string bundles but is not to be advertised to our users since this kind of feature should be provided more formally using a changeApplier. This behaviour is only necessary to get round a short-term issue in CollectionSpace that there is not time to resolve by other means.

r10335 | antranig@caret.cam.ac.uk | 2010-12-06 17:05:42 -0500 (Mon, 06 Dec 2010) | 7 lines

FLUID-3371, FLUID-3730: Numerous fixes to IoC system, including resolution of multiple expansion issues, correct bridging of "thatStack" across boundaries of fluid.invoke and deferredInvokeCall, correct treatment of arrays in "noCopy" mode, non-copying of direct arguments to fluid.invoke, as well as "proleptic ginger nicknames" - the ability to refer to a component by nickname which has not yet been instantiated (only in the form of nickname which comes from direct options or from a subcomponent name - resolving other forms of nickname proleptically requires the "global ginger world")
Work on I18N to allow rendererComponents to make use of injection of a "parent bundle" and creation of the new fluid.messageResolver API. This as well as messageLocator have been moved back from the renderer into Fluid trunk since they will be used by all components for screenreader support as well as general I18N.

r10314 | colin | 2010-11-29 18:56:07 -0500 (Mon, 29 Nov 2010) | 5 lines

FLUID-3722: Interim commit of Uploader strategy refactoring so I don't lose this. Fractured the strategies for both Flash and HTML into smaller units representing local and remote interfaces. Local contains all the queue and file related public API, while remote contains the methods required for communicating with the server. 

This change makes it easier to substitute either of the two remote strategies for the demo version. General cleanup and refactoring of the HTML 5 implementation code, especially around XHR handling. Still need to hide the dorkily named "engine", local, and remote behind a single strategy so users can easily switch implementations without knowing the details of what's behind it all.

FLUID-2652, FLUID-3801, FLUID-3757: Fixed a bug where on instantiation of inlineEdit, the textEditButton did not get the correct text assigned. This was due to the model being setup after the initial call to set the text on the button. Fixed a bug in the unit tests which would have caught this error. Added logic to update the button with the defaultViewText if the field is empty, and added a unit test for this functionality.  Also changed the defaultViewText for rich text inlineEdit to be "Click Edit" as the old message didn't make sense since you now have to click an explicit edit button to edit the text. For the new simple demo, changed the "Untitled" text from being in the markup to being the defaultViewText. Lastly I linted the unit test file. Hopefully I didn't add any new bugs with any of these changes.

FLUID-3825: Upgrade of fluid.fetchResources to support PROLEPTICK JOINSETS. The opportunity was taken to thoroughly refactor this rather gnarled nodule of pretty ancestral code that "just grew" as it came to handle more complexity. Now with a proper "that" as well as a dedicated namespace - previously unannounced functions "primeCacheFromResources" and "clearCache" have been moved into this fluid.fetchResources namespace. Addition of "mockjax" testing framework to our test image which allows the issuing of "deterministic asynchronous" tests of which "CachingTests.js" now exhibits the style. All possible interleavings of response cycles are tested to demonstrate correct behaviour of caching system - this exposed a fatal bug with the "forceCache" implementation to date.

FLUID-3819: Reimplementation of core utilities getBeanValue and setBeanValue using new strategy of "strategies" - adjustment of all framework pathways (change applier, renderer and renderer components) to permit transport of custom strategies to these utilities. New test cases for "renderer components" as created via "initRendererComponent". Bugs fixed as a result of these cases: a) proper cloning of UIBound components in protoComponent expander to ensure unshared state of expanded with repeat decorator, b) typo of $() for ${} in default options for protocomponent expander in renderer component, c) fluid.isArrayable now no longer crashes on empty argument, allowing d) fluid.each and fluid.transform to transform empty argument. Support for new merge policy of "noexpand" suitable for use with "protoTree" argument to a renderer component and others. Support for multiple merge policies targetted at a path (comma-separated in string). Current incomplete issues with implementation: i) not possible to specify a strategy adjusting access to the root model path of "", ii) no test cases covering changeApplier with strategy iii) no test cases for "resources" supplied for a renderer component (fluid.fetchResources in need of some more engineering to deal with coordinating joinsets)

r10062 | jobara | 2010-09-29 13:46:36 -0400 (Wed, 29 Sep 2010) | 3 lines

FLUID-2652: Reverting commits r10051 and 10059. There are now 4 possible options for us to take for this issue. 1) the original implementation, 2) providing save and edit buttons (this reverted implementation) 3) edit "button" with tooltip in edit mode 4) edit "button" with a described-by in edit mode. Reverting allows us to have the original implementation back in trunk and we'll branch and implement the other options in the incubator so that we can easily compare them. Once an appropriate solution has been found we will merge that one into trunk

r10057 | colin | 2010-09-27 17:47:12 -0400 (Mon, 27 Sep 2010) | 4 lines

FLUID-3750: Refactored SWFUploadSetupDecorator and parts of the SWFUploadManager to better separate concerns. There is now an object, fluid.uploader.flash, which represents the whole Flash-based subsystem of the Uploader (making it easier to introduce an HTML 5 subsystem). Specific functions, resolved by IoC, implement the SWFUpload-specific strategies required for the key life cycle methods: 1) setup the DOM for Flash, 2) init the underlying upload engine, and 3) bind engine-specific events.

These changes roughly work, but break all tests. Eek.

r10022 | antranig@caret.cam.ac.uk | 2010-09-02 16:20:24 -0400 (Thu, 02 Sep 2010) | 1 line

FLUID-2881: Stopgap fix forking "deferredCall" to "deferredInvokeCall" since the latter has some subtle impact on environmental resolution - it appears if used in the environment of component expansion the connection to the "that stack" is broken. For now, different views in CSpace will use different versions although in theory there should be only one of these. We do need to look into the general performance implications of always using "fluid.invoke" though.

r9999 | antranig@caret.cam.ac.uk | 2010-08-30 05:23:50 -0400 (Mon, 30 Aug 2010) | 1 line

FLUID-2881: Enhancement of Fluid IoC "multi-dispatch" to support various options merging across demands scenarios for use with CollectionSpace testing. "Resolution uncess system" tweaks resolution system to penalise rules with missed matches, and rules with zero matches are culled entirely. Test cases for these, as well as core framework utilities fluid.find, fluid.each added during earlier work.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r9998 | antranig@caret.cam.ac.uk | 2010-08-27 17:35:26 -0400 (Fri, 27 Aug 2010) | 1 line

FLUID-2881: Corrected implementation of fluid.locateDemands and also now permit a list of strings to appear as context names as 2nd argument to fluid.demands. Although this was considered a "forward-looking feature" it was found essential even to correctly operate the testing configuration within the CollectionSpace autocomplete component. This implementation performs a "maximum intersection count" between the complete set of discovered context names and the set requested in the demands block. This is an unideal implementation since there is the possibility for surprises in the case of ambiguous matches - this needs to be properly documented and alternative implementations considered. At the very least the system needs very good diagnostics to enable the particular resolution choice made by the system to be understood.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r9997 | stasia | 2010-08-27 10:14:57 -0400 (Fri, 27 Aug 2010) | 1 line

r9995 | antranig@caret.cam.ac.uk | 2010-08-26 04:04:49 -0400 (Thu, 26 Aug 2010) | 10 lines

FLUID-3681, FLUID-3659, FLUID-3683, FLUID-3688:
Widespread changes and improvements to IoC system driven by requirements for CSPACE-2637
Integrated "initRendererComponent" as a new top-level initialiser - "grade" work and "2-pass rendering" is still to come but basic renderer workflow is now available as an integrated package
Alignment of fluid.find with fluid.each, fluid.keyForValue and fluid.transform (TESTS REQUIRED!)
Fix for breakage of Undo component by change in contract of fluid.container (null container now means no component for initView) - this should really use fluid.initLittleComponent which did not exist at time of writing. This entire family needs to be updated for IoC.
Fix for "decorator with valuebinding" FLUID-3659 issue which is now properly understood - the issue actually affected a component which had "value" specified as an expandable EL expression rather than a plain path in "valuebinding". This mode should be supported for consistency and is frequently seen in CollectionSpace.
Further upgrades for fluid.fetchResources - now supports caching of resources with "forceCache" flag. This currently seems somewhat rickety since a "not modified" response from the seems to blow everything up. Ironically a stop-gap solution is to tell the server *NOT* to cache the request for the (subsequently) cacheable resource. More investigation required.
Numerous fixes to IoC - now has support for "static resolution in dynamic context" by appending the static environment onto the thatStack during resolution - required for bundling "test configurations" in CSpace without intruding on the basic component code. Corrected resolution of non-string arguments to resolve recursively as expected. Fix to "noexpand" expander which with "noCopy" semantic was simply causing noexpand material to disappear.
"Unusual" fix to renderer that allows it to locate repetitive leaves in parent contexts rather than infuriatingly giving the "downmap is undefined" error. This needs to look forward to proper work on scoping of names in the renderer.
Puzzled comment on "globalAccept" in DataBinding - why on earth is this here? Must go before we start using this stuff in Kettle.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

FLUID-3658: First passing test case for the repetition expander. FluidIoC and "Engage" concepts of EL expansion successfully merged - however, effects might not be completely non-surprising - for example, encountering an EL path in "component tree space" in the place of a UIBound will recognise the path as "valuebinding" and create a component that binds to the VALUE - however, the same expression in "configuration" space will simply expand to the PATH (at least, if it is a context expression - review this). Some special-casing in expander to detect repetitive leaves (not previously supported). Slight improvement in semantic for fluid.composePath and comment

iFLUID-3656: Creating a tag of the fix for this issue for use by CollectionSpace.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r9881 | antranig@caret.cam.ac.uk | 2010-05-19 01:52:36 -0400 (Wed, 19 May 2010) | 1 line

FLUID-3656: Significant reworking of id assignment logic to allow "markup id avoidance" to function. Some new special-casing is needed to support the expectation that decorators may be applied to the root of a UISelect in lieu of applying them to the "selection" element. In general, the "modern renderer" allows that the "final id" (new concept as of this revision) applied to a UISelect peer in the markup is the plain id derived from the fullID of the root UISelect, and not the version with "-selection" applied as per historical RSF. This correspondance generally merely confused users, although hopefully with this irregularity we have not closed the door to still allowing the other members of UISelect to be independently bound through bidirectional bindings (see upcoming work on FLUID-3387). Note that, as of this revision, FLUID-3657 has been "fixed" by removing the functionality for "parentAbsoluteId" - this is not recommended functionality and has been withdrawn (full IDs are not guaranteed to remain stable within the tree, although as of this revision they still are - modified value is currently written to field "finalID")
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r9880 | a.cheetham@utoronto.ca | 2010-05-18 17:41:30 -0400 (Tue, 18 May 2010) | 1 line

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r9800 | colin | 2010-04-01 09:08:51 -0400 (Thu, 01 Apr 2010) | 5 lines

FLUID-3577: Table of Contents tests working with new QUnit. Asynchronous testing works differently in this new version of QUnit--you can't stop() across phases of the testing lifecycle, meaning you can stop() in setup and expect to block test runs until start() is called. As a result, you need to run your tests within the callback of whatever asynchronous operation is being performed.

Updated jqUnit to provide an asyncTest() convenience method.


------------------------------------------------------------------------

ENGAGE-342: Correcting misspelled import during refactoring of core framework. In this branch, interaction now starts, but no effect on dropping with the mouse
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r9743 | antranig@caret.cam.ac.uk | 2010-03-29 11:42:43 -0400 (Mon, 29 Mar 2010) | 1 line

FLUID-3527: Previous versions of jQuery.data() would allow us to get access to the private id associated with a DOM node. It appears that this API was considered "undocumented" and this functionality was removed in jQuery 1.4 - there no longer appears to be any way to get access to this information. Accordingly, we will fall back on a strategy based on a physical DOM id, operated by fluid.allocateSimpleId (this API did not exist at the time GeometricManager was designed). We had hoped to avoid disrupting the DOM in this way but over time the use of this new API has proved apparently safe and stable and is used throughout the framework. All Reorderer automated tests now pass again.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r9742 | antranig@caret.cam.ac.uk | 2010-03-29 10:48:34 -0400 (Mon, 29 Mar 2010) | 1 line

FLUID-3527: There has been a change to the API of jQuery.index which now auto-detects the case where the argument is falsy, and goes into a mode where it detects the jQuery's own index within its array of DOM siblings. We need to explicitly guard against triggering this case for jQuery 1.4 and above (review other uses of "index" in the framework). With this change, all test cases now pass again.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

ENGAGE-344: Substantial refactoring of ArtifactView, ArtifactCollectView, and My Collection in preparation for merging My Collection with Engage 0.3 trunk. This commit includes:

 * Replacement of the user component with a handful of stateless functions that get and create user documents using the new user dataSpout.

 * Removal of NavBar-related functionality from My Collection in preparation for putting in the real NavBar.
 * We no longer render the My Collection NavList if no artifacts have been collected--still need to hide the raw template in this case.

r9350 | antranig@caret.cam.ac.uk | 2010-02-11 03:42:09 -0500 (Thu, 11 Feb 2010) | 6 lines

ENGAGE-310, ENGAGE-365: Integrated Guestbook as nested component within exhibition page. New "spouts" collection for guestbook specifically. Demonstration of "dummy" dataSource which is pointed at the same data within the filesystem as used for the filesystem demo.
Framework changes: Defeat of unnecessary conversion of markup/XML documents to DOM within env.js - this now only happens on explicit read of the responseXML property, which is only done by jQuery with good reason. As a side-effect of this change, httpData from jQuery is now being invoked correctly which exposed problems across the service layer which would now be parsing JSON twice as a result of (previously redundantly) specifying the contentType JSON parameter. This has been removed from all the cut-n-pasted services along with the unnecessary async parameter.

New Framework utilities: fluid.kettle.expandMountRelative will now convert a mount-relative specification such as  $infusion/framework/core/js/Fluid.js into a file-protocol URL - this eases the work of stably resolving files from anywhere in the image. 

Various tidying around the exhibition services to correctly direct them onto the "shared exhibition bundle" (only one of them was using it correctly until now)

r9244 | colin | 2010-02-02 18:55:11 -0500 (Tue, 02 Feb 2010) | 5 lines

ENGAGE-227: A very raw sketch of an unobtrusive technique for "all in one page" applications, aka Screen Navigator. This technique loads target pages as text and then runs a handful of RegExps on them to correctly inject their contents into the page. This code lacks any logic for avoiding multiple includes, and does very little to help the lingering back button problem. We also need to correctly re-base URLs in all target documents, which Kettle can probably help us with down the road.

This might serve as a starting point if we want to revisit jqTouch-style animated transitions between pages in an iPhone-ish way, but there's still quite a bit to do. In the meantime, we're doing well with the code in iPhoneChromelessness.js in Engage, which imposes fewer technical problems.
 

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r9243 | antranig@caret.cam.ac.uk | 2010-02-02 18:26:21 -0500 (Tue, 02 Feb 2010) | 1 line

ENGAGE-247: Removed redundant utility compileDatabaseURL
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r9242 | antranig@caret.cam.ac.uk | 2010-02-02 18:05:00 -0500 (Tue, 02 Feb 2010) | 7 lines

ENGAGE-247: Thorough-going reworking of Kettle "Services" - 
  Outermost mounted agencies now named "Spouts", taking outermost place in hierarchy of Spouts -> Acceptors -> Handlers
  Services now mounted automatically by creation - fluid.kettle.dataSpout and fluid.kettle.markupSpout will now schedule the mounting of the specified spout at the proper time during initialisation - "initServices" now deprecated in engageConfig.json
  New utilities fluid.kettle.expandEnvironment make use of portable ThreadLocal functionality - ported over from FluidIoC work in FLUID-2881 branch in advance of general merge. Access to environmentally defined values during expansion of configuration blocks
  New end-to-end testing functionality for Kettle. Kettle apps may now be tested through the complete process of URL resolution and markup by means of mockups for the container-specific functionality in kettleAppTests.js - this will shortly be moved into a standalone set of utilities (also some shared matter with upcoming FluidIoC.js here) 
  kettle.js factored into low-level utilities kettleUtils.js
  Testing for correct mounting and resolution of Spouts, fixes for configuration of template resolution, synchronous I/O etc. required by running Kettle from the filesystem.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

ENGAGE-216, ENGAGE-193, ENGAGE-214: Work on mount routing now complete. App verified in both standalone and Jetty embedded configurations. Property "rewriteSource" is now eliminated - rewritten URLs are "just correct". Cleanup of a "finally" block in kettle, and also marking of "false URLs" in the home template and others as non-rewrite using rsf:id="scr=null" - this should probably be done in the component tree somehow, although we have no ViewParameters support yet for generating stable internal URLs.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r9169 | antranig@caret.cam.ac.uk | 2010-01-27 17:14:14 -0500 (Wed, 27 Jan 2010) | 1 line

ENGAGE-216, ENGAGE-193, ENGAGE-214: Authoritative fix for mount system - now on a considerably different "virtual absolute path"-based system that relaxes a lot of former restrictions and should make it much easier to understand configuration. Also, beginnings of test system for Kettle (currently just a conventional client-based system that can only test those parts of the framework that do not depend on the container). Changes to renderer to allow arbitrary function-based URL rewriting rather than imagining it can operate the rewrite rules by itself. Note that as of the previous commit, templates are now back on the "historical RSF system" whereby things that look like relative URLs will be rewritten to account for change of position, unless explicitly marked with rsf:id="scr=null".

r9121 | antranig@caret.cam.ac.uk | 2010-01-24 23:53:14 -0500 (Sun, 24 Jan 2010) | 2 lines

ENGAGE-283: I18N work - Upgraded recognition of UIVerbatim components to allow both message resolution as well as model references. Upgraded pathway for recognising UIMessage arguments to allow transmission into fluid.stringTemplate resolvers. Parameterised fluid.messageLocator to allow wrapping of the fluid.stringTemplate strategy, as well as the historical Java-inspired format. This has fed down into the generalisation of the fundamental framework utility fluid.transform to allow it to transform free hashes as well as arrays, filling a much-needed gap in the literature. 
Test cases for these. Test framework upgraded to allow assertions on raw node markup by means of the key "nodeHTML" to jqUnit.assertNode().
------------------------------------------------------------------------

ENGAGE-278: First stab at media badge icons for grid view. Badge is now floating nicely. Fairly substantial refactoring of the Exhibition Preview compoennt to improve Awesomeness, including: 
 
* removed unncessary use of attribute decorators for rendering links and images; now we're using the correct Renderer component with a "target" property
* refactored tree generation functions so they more accurately name the things being built up
* more efficient and readable use of renderer function by storing it for later use and wrapping it in a public refreshView() method
* made the model a public  member of the component itself, instead of just hiding it in the options
* removing unncessary styling and smelly use of !important where possible

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r8619 | colin | 2009-11-08 19:21:38 -0500 (Sun, 08 Nov 2009) | 5 lines

FLUID-3372: Basic built-in VideoPlayer support for graceful degradation to the YouTube player in non-HTML 5 browsers. This is achieved through "media renderers" registered to the MIME type of the video source passed in as an option to the player. This now allows for one-shot creation of a Video Player that supports a wider range of browsers, without the need to nest your own additional markup in the HTML.

This code should probably be refactored to use SWFObject instead of raw DOM injection. Also need to think a little bit about fake mime types like the one used for YouTube. Interesting question: can our player chrome actually control the YouTube player and sync captions to it?


------------------------------------------------------------------------
r8618 | colin | 2009-11-08 18:25:24 -0500 (Sun, 08 Nov 2009) | 3 lines

FLUID-3371: General cleanup. Moved setCaption out into Video Player's public API. Split the in/out time normalization code into a separate function. Linted and added license statement.


------------------------------------------------------------------------
r8617 | colin | 2009-11-08 13:57:46 -0500 (Sun, 08 Nov 2009) | 3 lines

FLUID-3368: Moved the code to update the Play/Pause button's text status out into listeners for the HTML 5 video play and pause events. This way, the button always stays up to date with the video's play status. Also added code to initially disable the button until the video can play. Added a handful of comments to aid understanding, at least until we get some unit tests for this thing.


------------------------------------------------------------------------
r8616 | colin | 2009-11-08 13:38:33 -0500 (Sun, 08 Nov 2009) | 3 lines

FLUID-3367: Bind the scrubber set up code to HTML 5 video's "durationchange" event instead of "load" to ensure that the scrubber is usable before the video has entirely downloaded from the server.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r8193 | antranig@caret.cam.ac.uk | 2009-10-01 13:43:21 -0400 (Thu, 01 Oct 2009) | 1 line

FLUID-2980, FLUID-2962: Fixes and test case for multiple decorator issue. This was actually caused by failure of re-entrancy in the renderer, which was being invoked recursively in the case where the fluid decorator designated a component which itself invoked the renderer. Establishing reentrancy for the renderer actually puts this work also under the heading of FLUID-2962 which required to enable the renderer for multi-threaded access for use on the server-side, which work had been incomplete but seen as lower priority for this release until now. This reorganisation creates a new top-level API fluid.renderer which follows the "that-ist" convention that is now standard for the framework, but which had not been in place when the renderer was initially designed. The original low-level API fluid.renderTemplates is preserved for backwards compatibility, but should be deprecated in a future release - in this implementation, it forwards to an invocation of the that-ist API which can be "stealthed" for this release but which should be advertised in future ones. The fluid.renderTemplates API does not provide any mechanism for decorators to be honoured - but it never did in any case, so this behaviour remains consistent. More thought and design is needed over future releases to create a family of strategies for honouring decorators, which will become very important as they begin to be used more cooperatively between client and server with the implementation of Kettle.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r8192 | a.cheetham@utoronto.ca | 2009-10-01 12:35:01 -0400 (Thu, 01 Oct 2009) | 1 line

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r8139 | colin | 2009-09-26 16:49:51 -0400 (Sat, 26 Sep 2009) | 5 lines

FLUID-3115: Victory! Fixed an error in an old fix for FLUID-2720 that, weirdly enough, was causing SWFUpload to have a fit. I still can't quite explain it, but in FF3.5, SWFUpload was reitializing itself when a new file row was faded into the queue. By removing the incorrect fl-uploader-hidden-templates style from the row (which had a style of display: none), and then fading it in, everything works again. 

Uploader is now 100% functional in all our supported browsers.

FLUID-2916: Cleaned up the js code a bit, added an Animation function too.
Due to a webkit bug (23209) css animations cannot work with css generated content yet. A disturbing discovery when using image-based animations is that not only does webkit not support APNG's, but as of v4 it caps the FPS for animated GIFs based on the number of frames, resulting in a less-than-perfect animation sequence.

FLUID-2901: Working version of Jack and Narwhal for doing server side JavaScript with Rhino, along couple of other things:

1. A SecureModules-compliant package of Fluid Infusion, including Resig's Envjs for DOM compatibility.

FLUID-2720: In IE8 the table rows for the queue must not be hidden before being added to the queue, as the .show() will fail.

In addFile (line 360):
        /* FLUID-2720 - do not hide the row under IE8 */
        if (!($.browser.msie && ($.browser.version >= 8))) {
            row.hide();
        }    



In prepareTemplateElements (line 457):
        /* FLUID-2720 - do hide the row under IE8 */
        if ($.browser.msie && ($.browser.version >= 8)) {
            that.rowTemplate.removeClass(that.options.styles.hiddenTemplate).removeClass(that.options.styles.rowTemplate);
        }


Not using a table for the file queue would fix the problem as well.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

FLUID-2649: Committing Laurel Williams' FLUID-2639-2 patch with some changes. 1) The majority of the patch was good, but there were some naming issues regarding the fss modules that caused it to not work. The module names specified in the properties file did not match the actual module names, and the key within the fss dependency json files should have been the same as the module name. (I have corrected these issues). 2) In order for the build scripts properly concatenate the files an overall FSS dependency file was added; this points at the other fss modules. This will allow a user to specify all FSS modules at once, or just the ones needed. Also to ensure that the FSS css files were in the first position of the concatenated file, the fss module was hardcoded into the build.js file at the first position, when building InfusionAll. This will need to be looked at in the future.

FLUID-2596: Support tag elision for branches.
Note that this commit also includes:
i) API upgrade for iterateDOM

iii) "template armouring" upgrade for selfRender - note that whilst this in theory supports both CDATA and comment armouring, CDATA nodes seem not to be supportable in IE (their nodeValue arrives corrupt) and so comment armouring is the only form we can support.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r6607 | eli@media.berkeley.edu | 2009-02-26 19:10:29 -0500 (Thu, 26 Feb 2009) | 28 lines

FLUID-2297: removed old code from Progress, reran tests

In Progress changed this:

	that.refresh = function (newProgressBarElm) {
    	if (newProgressBarElm) {
        	that.progressBar = newProgressBarElm;
    	}
    
    	repositionIndicator(that);
	};

To this: 

	that.refresh = function () {
    	repositionIndicator(that);
	};

And removed the code that reset the width when repositioning an element, as you would want to reset the indicators width explicitly not when repositioning the element:

	var repositionIndicator = function (that) {
        that.indicator.css("top", that.progressBar.position().top)
            .css("left", 0)
            .height(that.progressBar.height())
            .width(that.options.minWidth);
    };
    
Also removed the element argument from the one place in Uplaoder.js that calls Progress.refresh(). It would never pass a different argument than the one that it was initailized with.

FLUID-2136: When we remove a row we also remove it's progressor. 

Note: we're still leaving behind the progressor when a file has uploaded successfully even though it will never be used again. The problem with removing the progressor when a file is successful is that the progressor will be removed before it gets a chance to display 100% progress. There is some rethinking of the flow of the Uploader that could fix this but it doesn't seem worth messing with.

FLUID-1948:

- added a counter for the number of files that errorred. Not using it yet, but it's there hidden in the code. 
- removed a spurious pass of the error to the fileStatusUpdater, it didn't cause a bug but we also were not using it
- moved the SWFUpload error constants into our own constants. 
- moved fileStatus constants to uploader for consistency 
- fixed tests that broke because of this move
- added tests to handle the CANCELLED state screwing up getUploadedFiles();
- fixed getUploadedFiles() to also accept files that have a status of CANCELLED (Note: only files that are CANCELLED by an Upload Cancelled event will show up as CANCELLED, since files that have been removed are no longer in the queue)
- checking for the number of files still in queue and then setting the state to "done" or "loaded" as appropriate which in turn sets the display of the buttons

Some code which fixed FLUID-1947 on the server side but more work needs to be done for a fix for the locally running Uploader

r5926 | eli@media.berkeley.edu | 2008-10-30 13:51:39 -0400 (Thu, 30 Oct 2008) | 7 lines

FLUID-1749: Updated the README.txt file with updated language covering the Flash 10 bug:

* Uploader: The Uploader is currently NOT COMPATIBLE with Flash 10 (released on 9/26/2008). This 
  bug is caused by a change in Adobe's security protocols for Flash 10, which block the SWFUpload 
  code from calling the OS File browser. The SWFUpload community is still implementing a fix based 
  on overlaying a transparent Flash object over the HTML Browse button. The Uploader in Fluid 0.6 
  will include this fix, or a fix of our own. 
------------------------------------------------------------------------

r5857 | eli@media.berkeley.edu | 2008-10-28 13:27:19 -0400 (Tue, 28 Oct 2008) | 10 lines

NOJIRA:
Changed:
    demoState.bytesUploaded = demoState.bytesUploaded 
                            + demoState.chunkSize;

To:
   demoState.bytesUploaded = Math.min(demoState.bytesUploaded 
                   + Math.min(demoState.chunkSize,file.size),file.size);

so that the demo uploader never reports that chunkSize or the bytesUploaded are larger than the actual file size.

FLUID-1321: Changes to the way the component model is backed-up:
At undo decorator initialization, copy the model into both initialModel and extremalModel;

Only update the initial model if there was actually an edit (using the extremal model as reference)

r5633 | colin | 2008-09-21 19:56:35 -0400 (Sun, 21 Sep 2008) | 12 lines

FLUID-1077: Moved a number of functions out of Fluid.js and into a new DOMUtilities.js file. This file is intended as a place for highly optimized pure DOM utilities that don't generally use jQuery, such as those found in parts of the Reorderer. This file now represents the fluid.dom namespace.

fluid.dom.iterateDom
fluid.dom.computeAbsolutePosition
fluid.dom.isContainer
fluid.dom.insertAfter
fluid.dom.isWhitespaceNode
fluid.dom.isIgnorableNode
fluid.dom.cleanseScripts
fluid.dom.dumpEl

FLUID-1347: Refinement of the Progress widget:
- added default to allow for animation in one direction or both
- added a ceiling of 100%
- round pixels to integer, which avoids some inconsistency on browsers with decimal pixel sizes
- added the ability to hide the Progress immediately
- updating the Progress will show Progress first if it is hidden
- which element gets shown or hidden has its own explicit selector as opposed to figuring it out based on whether there is a wrapping container or not

FLUID-1148: Going to bed commit - final issue is determining relationship between "inferred" ModuleLayout selectors and their parents in Reorderer. Currently this is done externally in LayoutCustomiser, however this approach guarantees that ModuleLayout is never usable in isolation. Now, LayoutHandlers and Reorderer share *both* options structure *and* DOM binder - can we somehow insist that LayoutHandler lifecycle will interject and attack options? Of course, this ensures that LayoutHandlers are never *testable* in isolation, however this has not been possible for some days.

FLUID-938: slightly hacky work-around for an IE bug, since IE can not style an empty inline element, so force element to be display: inline-block

line 66:
        if ($.browser.msie) {
            if (textEl.css('display') === 'inline') {
                textEl.css('display', "inline-block");
            }
        }

r5177 | colin | 2008-06-28 04:14:05 -0400 (Sat, 28 Jun 2008) | 9 lines

FLUID-839: Created a new function for instantiating a whole set of Inline Edit components:

fluid.inlineEdits(containerId, options); // Returns an [] of inline edit instances. 

Also created a new fluid.container() function that enforces a single container element for each component. This can be specified via a unique id (preferably), a single-element jQuery, or a single DOM Element. container() returns a jQuery instance, or throws an exception if there isn't exactly one container.

Minor InlineEdit refactoring.

FLUID-513: Update the sample code and test files to use the new combined keyboard-a11y plugin.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r4912 | a.cheetham@utoronto.ca | 2008-04-30 11:23:00 -0400 (Wed, 30 Apr 2008) | 1 line

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r4779 | colin | 2008-04-04 12:18:50 -0400 (Fri, 04 Apr 2008) | 3 lines

FLUID-429: Fixed the bug where items weren't getting removed from the right-hand list. The fix involved using the standard no-arg version of jQuery's clone function, rather than clone(true) which also clones event handlers. As a result, the "add" event handler was getting cloned and thus items in the right-hand list, when clicked on, would get removed and then re-added to the list.

r4774 | michelle.dsouza@utoronto.ca | 2008-04-02 14:12:05 -0400 (Wed, 02 Apr 2008) | 17 lines

NOJIRA: Colin's patch to put the Reorderer into a closure. [CC]
Summary of changes:

 * Wrapped the Reorderer in its own closure. This gave me a private, "this"-free spot to move functions into.
 * Moved several defaults out of the constructor and into the private space, renaming them as "default..."
 * Made the cssClasses a configurable option, since a comment suggested it was a good idea and it was easy
 * Moved the firstSelectable () method out, making it take a findItems argument instead of relying on "this"
 * Broke setupDomNode () into two separate functions that don't rely on "this" anymore:
     * bindHandlersToContainer(), which... well, the name says it all. ;)
     * addRolesToContainer(), also self-explanatory
 * Moved changeSelectedToDefault() out, making it "this"-free. It now takes the cssClasses as an arg.
 * Major changes to _setActiveItem():
    * Renamed it to selectItem()
    * Combined it with related code in handleFocus()
    * Moved it out into the truly public API, adding it as a method on Reorderer.prototype

r4547 | colin | 2007-12-17 20:06:37 -0500 (Mon, 17 Dec 2007) | 10 lines

FLUID-83: Proof of concept version of working ARIA roles. 

1. Removed the xhtml10: namespace from the role attribute of all our ARIA roles to make FireFox happy.
2. Removed the orderable-focus-targets added by stasia to the lightbox-cell divs, since they'll never be noticed by the Reorderer 
3. Created a Lightbox.js file which contains a function that will handle the Enter key press on the lightbox-cell.
4. Fixed a bug in the LightboxTests.testPersistFocus() where blur() wasn't being called before focussing a non-Lightbox element.

This commit shows a continuing problem with the Reorderer for ARIA support: that we don't actually focus each element, we retain focus on the parent gallery:::thumbs::: container instead. So the individual thumbnail roles aren't being read properly.
